intro: Synaphea drummondii, commonly known as the Drummond's synaphea, is a species of flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, greenish-white flowers that bloom in early spring. Its leaves are finely divided and often emit a mild, spicy scent. Synaphea drummondii is typically found in rocky soils and open habitats, thriving in arid to semi-arid environments.
